str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
Robbing temples, but possibly simply: sacrilegious. From hieron and sulao; a temple-despoiler.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
